newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Mid-Atlantic spot power steady, next-day up.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Mid-Atlantic spot power steady, next-day up.

text.p: U.S. Mid-Atlantic spot electricity prices held relatively steady Wednesday, with the exception of next day power which rose on expectations of hot weather Thursday and Friday, industry sources said.
"We're actually going to hit 90 (degrees Fahrenheit) for the first time since June," said one Houston-based short-term power marketer.

Prices in the Pennsylvania-New Jersey-Maryland (PJM) power pool for next day, on peak delivery, were talked in the $31.00-34.00 range with several unconfirmed trades reported at $33.50, brokers and marketers said.
Next-day PJM was talked at $29.00-31.00 on Tuesday.

Power for the five business days of next week was discussed lower at $24.00-25.00 with unconfirmed trades reported at $25.00, from a range of $24.75-25.50 on Tuesday, sources said. Temperatures were expected to ease next week.
September PJM power, also for firm, peak delivery, was assessed relatively steady in the $22.20-22.75 range with one unconfirmed trade reported at $22.50, the sources said.
October PJM electricity with similar delivery terms was said to have traded at $20.50, steady within Tuesday's range of $20.00-20.65, the sources said.
-- Chris Reese, New York Power Desk 212-859-1627
